title: Couscous with Vegetables
instructions: Heat olive oil in a pan and sauté onions until translucent.
Add carrots, zucchini, and bell pepper, and cook until tender.
Boil the vegetable broth and pour it over the couscous in a bowl.
Cover the bowl and let the couscous absorb the broth for about 5 minutes.
Fluff the couscous with a fork, mix in the sautéed vegetables, and season with salt and pepper.

title: Kibbeh
instructions: Soak bulgur in water for 30 minutes, then drain well.
Combine ground meat, bulgur, onions, and spices in a bowl.
Shape into small balls or patties.
Heat oil in a deep pan and fry kibbeh until golden brown and crispy.
Serve with yogurt or tahini sauce.

title: Schnitzel and Rice
instructions: Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
Dredge in flour, dip in beaten eggs, and coat with breadcrumbs.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the schnitzels until golden brown.
Cook rice in water with butter until fluffy.
Serve schnitzels hot with rice on the side.

title: Ikra on Bread with Butter
instructions: Roast the eggplant until soft, then peel and mash it.
Mix in garlic, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Spread butter on slices of bread, then top with eggplant caviar.
Serve as an appetizer or snack.

title: Stir-Fried Tofu
instructions: Heat sesame oil in a pan and sauté garlic until fragrant.
Add tofu cubes and cook until golden on all sides.
Add bell pepper, zucchini, and onion, and stir-fry until tender.
Season with soy sauce, salt, and pepper.
Serve hot with rice or noodles.

title: Borscht (Russian Beetroot Soup)
ingredients: Sour cream and dill for garnish
instructions: In a large pot, cook beef in broth until tender.
Add onions, carrots, potatoes, beetroots, and cabbage.
Stir in tomato paste, season with salt and pepper, and simmer until vegetables are soft.
Serve hot, garnished with sour cream and fresh dill.
